result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Candace Ann Boyle

records.addlTxt:
Further proceedings on December 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.


*UPDATED HEARING NOTICE: COURT WILL ADDRESS DEFENDANT'S REQUEST FOR BAIL MODIFICATION AT HEARING SET FOR ABOVE DATE/TIME.
from the defendant re: request for signature bond. Forwarded to Clerk DA for review.
Doc for review to Clerk AB to schedule video

10:11 AM Defendant Candace Ann Boyle appeared by video, in custody of Taycheedah Correctional.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Candace Ann Boyle.  Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to Withdraw heard. Blood results are not in yet. Counsel will transfer file to newly assigned counsel. Court will allow Atty Buckett to withdraw. Next hearing date already on the court's calendar for 12/15/22 at 1:15pm. Defendant will be released from Taycheedah Correctional and in custody of OZSD for next hearing date.

2:36pm Clerk confirmed defendant no longer in Oz Co Jail and currently at Taycheedah Correctional.  Video arranged for Zoom appearance 10/11/22 at 10am.  Clerk notified DA's office to prepare a video OTP.
Atty Buckett re: Withdrawal.  Forwarded as document for review to Branch 3 clerk .

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Copy of Information provided to counsel who waives reading and enters a not guilty plea. Defendant is currently serving another sentence. Defense does not wish to be heard on bail. State does not expect lab results until January 2023.

2:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Matthew Nugent  in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Candace Ann Boyle appeared by video, in custody of OZSD.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Candace Ann Boyle. 
2:06pm Officer M. Zilke sworn and testified. State rests. No defense testimony. State moves for bind over. Defense moves to dismiss and gives argument supporting. Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for trial. State informs.
Further proceedings scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on December 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

10:23 AM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Candace Ann Boyle appeared by video, in custody of OZSD.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Candace Ann Boyle. Defendant is on a probation hold. Counsel waives timelimits and requests a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Status hearing on April 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

*Defendant's hearing notice c/o OZSD
Email request by Atty Buckett for this case to be reset from 4/12/22 to 4/28/22 at 10am. Clerk rescheduled, hearing notices sent.
Status hearing on April 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. No possession of drug paraphernalia

1:07 PM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Candace Ann Boyle appeared by video, in custody. Atty Heather Dvoran appears stating defendant will qualify for public defender representation. Reading waived. Court finds probable cause. State requests $7500.00 cash bail with conditions. Defendant is currently on a probation hold. Time limits waived.
Status hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
